item.title: Java Generics Bounded Wildcards - CodeTab
item.description: Bounded Wildcards We can use wildcard ? with either upper or lower bound. Extends The <? extends Type> is a wildcard with upper bound. Extends allows us to restrict the unbounded List<?> to some type and its subtypes. For example, we want restrict display method only to Food and its subclasses and for change list parameter as below. public void display(List<? extends Food> list) { // display the list elements } display(new ArrayList<Food>()); display(new ArrayList<Snack>()); display(new ArrayList<Cookie>()); display(new ArrayList<Fruit>()); display(new ArrayList<Apple>()); display(new ArrayList<String>()); // error display(new ArrayList<Integer>()); // error Now display() accepts only the list of Food and its subtypes - Snack, Cookie, Fruit, Apple and nothing else.
